references.paper_title: High-dimensional analysis of semidefinite relaxations for sparse principal components
references.reason: This paper provides foundational information theoretic lower bounds for the sparse PCA problem, which is highly relevant to the SSL setting studied in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Higher criticism for detecting sparse heterogeneous mixtures
references.reason: This paper establishes fundamental limits for support recovery in the high-dimensional sparse Gaussian mixture model, which are crucial for understanding the information-theoretic limits of SSL.

references.paper_title: Sure Independence Screening for Ultrahigh Dimensional Feature Space
references.reason: This paper introduces the Sure Independence Screening (SIS) method, a key technique for variable selection in high dimensions, which is leveraged in the proposed LSPCA algorithm.

references.paper_title: Efficient Bayesian Estimation from Few Samples: Community Detection and Related Problems
references.reason: This paper introduces the low-degree likelihood framework and hardness conjecture, which are used to establish computational lower bounds for SSL.

references.paper_title: Detection and feature selection in sparse mixture models
references.reason: This paper analyzes the computational and statistical tradeoffs for support recovery and classification in sparse Gaussian mixture models, which provides valuable context for the SSL analysis.
